The search results will show you the nearest offices, their addresses, and available services.

redactedQuestion: Forgot my personal access code? How to sign in

If you've forgotten your CRA user ID or password, you can recover or reset them online.

For specific options and steps to obtain your notice of assessment, it's best to check the CRA's official guidance.

originalQuestion: How long should you avoid contact with others if you have covid
redactedQuestion: How long should you avoid contact with others if you have covid

paragraphs: If you have COVID-19, you should isolate for at least 5 days after your symptoms started or after your positive test date if you have no symptoms.
After 5 days, you can end isolation if your symptoms have improved and you've been fever-free for at least 24 hours without medication.
However, you should continue to wear a mask in public settings for an additional 5 days.
Specific guidelines may vary based on your situation and local public health advice.

originalQuestion: How should I sign into my CRA account?
redactedQuestion: How should I sign into my CRA account?

paragraphs: To sign into your CRA account, you should always use the same sign-in option you registered with.

There are three main options available:

1.

CRA user ID and password
2.

Interac sign-in partner (using your online banking credentials)
3.

Provincial digital ID for Alberta.ca or BC Services Card

Choose the option you originally used to set up your account.
If you're unsure which option to use or need more information, you can visit the CRA My Account sign-in page.

originalQuestion: when i sign in my cra indiviual account, they asking is amounts you reported on your most recent tax return but i haven't. How can i sign in, please help me. Thank Yo
redactedQuestion: when i sign in my cra indiviual account, they asking is amounts you reported on your most recent tax return but i haven't. How can i sign in, please help me. Thank Yo

paragraphs: If you haven't filed your taxes for the current or previous tax year, you won't be able to register for CRA's sign-in services using a CRA user ID and password or a Sign-In Partner. This is because the CRA uses information from your recent tax returns to verify your identity during the registration process.
Here are your options:
1. File your taxes: The best solution is to file your taxes for the current or previous tax year. Once your return is assessed, you'll be able to register for My Account.

2. If you live in British Columbia or Alberta: You may be able to register for My Account using your provincial digital ID (BC Services Card or Alberta.ca Account), as long as you have filed your taxes at least once in the past.
3. Contact the CRA: If you're unable to file your taxes immediately and need urgent access to your account, you may need to contact the CRA directly for assistance.
For information on how to file your taxes, you can visit the "Get ready to do your taxes" page on the CRA website.
aiResponse.citationHead: Use this Government of Canada link to check your answer and take the next step:
